intro: Brossaea pyrolifolia, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers in late spring, which are clustered in inflorescences at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are typically evergreen, glossy, and elliptical in shape, providing year-round interest in the landscape. Brossaea pyrolifolia thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
